greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the sum of the k X k minors in the n X n Pascal matrix (0<=k<=n; the empty 0 X 0 minor is defined to be 1).
comment: Apparently, the sum of the entries in row n is A005157(n).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..12, flattened
formula: The triangle is symmetric: T(n,k) = T(n,n-k).
example: T(3,1) = 7 because in the 3 X 3 Pascal matrix [1,0,0/1,1,0/1,2,1] the sum of the entries is 7.
maple: T:= proc(n, k) option remember; `if`(n-k<k, T(n, n-k), (l-> add(add(
i, j)), j in l), i in l))(choose([$1..n], k)))
seq(seq(T(n, k), k=0..n), n=0..7);  # _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 11 2019
mathematica: T[n_, k_] /; 0 < k < n := T[n, k] = If[n - k < k, T[n, n - k], M = Table[ Binomial[i - 1, j - 1], {i, n}, {j, n}]; Function[l, Sum[m = M[[i, j]]; If[m == {}, 0, Det[m]], {i, l}, {j, l}]]][Subsets[Range[n], {k}]] /. s_[{__}] -> s;
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 9}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 09 2019 *)
results.author: _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 12 2011
ext: Typo corrected by _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 11 2019
